comments.body: awesome idea
I do like the idea of having different sounds between ghast fireball, tnt, and end crystal (or more if I’m missing anything).
And you could change it in the Music & Sounds Options? That sounds really good!
That's doable with a Resource Pack...
You should be able to record your hurt sound and die sound

I'd like the old "OOF" sound effect back.

The current one sounds like they had a 5 year old voice it, and while that's cute and appeals to the younger audience that will most certainly play this game, it doesn't cut it for me, someone who's been playing Minecraft for 7 years now.

@ClockSpiral .

No, not on Bedrock Edition.
bring back the old 'OOF!' sound, it was so much more funnier than the current sound
Endermites and silverfish actually have walking sounds in the files, but they don't play on Java Edition (presumably due to a bug).
Endermite sounds should be distorted and has effects to make them sound more ethereal and mysterious!

A mooshroom should sound reminiscent of a cow, obviously, but perhaps with some bassy low pass, and perhaps a bit of phasing towards the end.
Think of what a "moo" would sound like from the other end of a didgeridoo: Very constrained, "startchy", like it came out of a moldy cow

End mobs could have very unique sounds, since their home is very unique. It would be exciting to hear what Mojang come up with for the endermite. (Of course I hope they'll revamp the mob in other ways as well, since it's a very unfinished feature. I remember Dinnerbone had some great Ultimate plan for them when they were added, but he never revealed it. Hopefully the mob can get its unique identity some time soon.)
Or "Grumm"
Also they could hide secret messages in new discs that are added (or just modify the current ones a bit).
You could implement this gag in an adventure map with resources and stuff.
how would you name a jukebox
This would be fantastic especially from an immersion standpoint. Thanks for posting!
There is nothing more satisfying in combat than that nice bone-crunching sound.
agree plz add
I really like the noise of the critical hits in Java please add the noise back before mc bedrock was out we had the noise why did they take it away :'(
Messi el mejvfjzkKn
Yeah the crit sound effect isn't there

You can separate out the textures from the sounds in a resource pack into two separate resource packs already by messing with the files.

I can see it would be useful if in-game, when you select your resource pack, you could turn on and off language, models, sound, textures, and texts separately when you've selected a resource pack.
This would be useful instead of a pack sandwich in Minecraft BR

on the bedrock market place there is a section like this but holds the original music and has been there since you had to manually download the music but the only thing in the section is the original music.

I just started playing Minecraft for the first time yesterday, and this has been on my mind quite a lot.  Aesthetically, I love playing with the Mario Mash-Up pack that comes with the Switch version, but the soundtrack is a big issue.  Don't get me wrong: I love Mario 64's soundtrack, but I don't think it fits the atmosphere of this game at all.  I'd love it if I could keep the default music while still using the Mario textures.
would love that
Great idea, more audio feedback is needed in this game
Yeah, this is a really good idea
Easily done with outside music-playing sources.
I have a feel Microsoft wouldn’t allow this to happen.
i like the new soundtrack and all but it really isn't much compared to c418 and his timeless nostalgic masterpieces, add a setting please Mojang, it is super easy.
I would like to only Listen to C418's music. Bring him back I beg of you.
How about a toggle with just Lena Raine’s music or Aaron Cherof’s music or Kumi Tanioka’s music too?
Yes please. I really hope they do this
Maybe further it could be a way to configure what music plays when, i.e. I wanna listen to C418s creative track in survival
the c418 creative music in survival mode happened at one point in 2014 when minecraft was released on xbox one and ps4 but didnt come to 360, ps3 until 2015 in tu24

Making it an option to turn off the directional sound of a jukebox would also be a good option. For someone who is sound sensitive, it nausea inducing the way the sound change when you move in game which is a shame as the in game records are good and it would be neat to be able to listen to them.

so sad that this 3 year old post only has 10 votes because this is SUCH a big problem for me. turning it down needs to be an accessibility option it is absolutely unbearable. im so glad im not the only one
Bumping this!! It is physically uncomfortable to use jukeboxes due to how aggressive the audio panning is.

Jukeboxes are unlistenable unless you're staring directly at them. I just want to listen to a record while building. I'm fine with directional audio, but there shouldn't be an apparent 95% difference in volume between my ears. Moving around while a jukebox plays feels less like listening to music and more like listening to a fly buzz around your head.
I really hoped there would be a solution for this, but unfotrunitly, still no..

I just built a red stone device for controlling a jukebox in my base and was supper disappointed to find out that it's useless since I can't actually hear the records unless I'm physically looking in the right direction. I've built things like this in the past and it didn't used to be like that. I also tested it on my switch and jukebox sound was not directional. I think this is a bug. If you're having the same problem, here's a link to the bug report: https://report.bugs.mojang.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/6/MCPE-220853?created=true
Literally I can stand right next to the jukebox and if I turn around and face away the audio fades completely. I swear it didn't used to do this, maybe my old directional audio wasn't as good?

Accessibility issue. I can't bear to play and disks unless being really careful to balance the audio in both ears or setting my entire computer to mono. Turning my head should not reduce the music playing in one ear to almost nil. This is not what stereo sound was invented for and not how it is typically used. We need a fix for this!
I agree, and the volume should be increased as well; the volume for placing a bell is louder than the actual ringing sound itself.
I made a cathedral and put a bell with daylight sensors but i could not hear the bell when it rung
Would be cool to make a bell tower, but in bedrock the sound only goes 16 blocks!!! wouldnt even hear it from the ground level of the tower let alone neighboring mountains

Or if you put certain blocks under/above the bell, it would increase the sound radius, just like how note blocks play different instruments when certain blocks are put underneath. Or an enchantment like Loudness with a few tiers.
I just built a bell tower and contained in the roof a setup to ring the bell 4 times when the sun goes down.. imagine my surprise when I couldn't hear it in the town even if I was close...

i agree i have a bell in a church tower on my server and i want evreyone in the city to hear the bells now the bell is like at 32 blocks but like time it by 10 or sum like bells in real life got a radius of 5km so why not make it so in minecraft to or maybe just like 100 block radius 5000 blocks is a little to much so like 100 or 150 would be perfect

We got goat horns' range increased from 16 to 256 blocks during 1.20.40, so I think it makes complete sense that a bell would get a similar treatment. A bell of this size irl can easily be heard from a great distance, and this would give the bell much more purpose than it has.
I agree! and the regular rain storms, with no thunder and lightning, should have lighter blue rain.

@ Nox cgt 

Ooh, that’s a good idea too!

I would love some more aesthetic rain sound effects, the current sound is jarring and almost painful, it propagates a range of hearing that's very uncomfortable, this usually prompts me to mute rain entirely but I otherwise love having the weather.

Maybe the game should have a rain intensity value, but is always maxed out during a thunderstorm

This effects how loud it is, how much there is and the colour of the sky

the current rain textures and sounds would be the heaviest

While I agree that adding a way to adjust note block volume would be good, I think this is not the way to do it because redstone signal strength is not easy to control, especially if you are trying to pack a whole tune into a compact space. (Or so I would think, I'm no expert)
To add to this idea: what if you could place wool blocks/carpet on top of the noteblock to make them quieter, but not mute them (like placing any other block would)?
Yes, but not too loud!

That's cool but, personaly, I think it would be even better with the normal fire sound most of the time and a "soul scream" here and there at random.

Also, the scream should be not very loud, maybe even almost barely udible, so that it seems to come from very far away.

394065870271 I think you are right about how loud it should be(maybe slightly louder) and include the regular fire sound but I think it should scream all scream 60% of the time (the screaming and fire sounds can overlap), and, of course, different variants of the sound.
It should sound like fire and screaming. If it only sounded like screaming, you wouldn't identify it as fire without seeing it.
Related to this, soul campfire smoke soul look like the faces on soul sand
No. Some random kid on a Minecraft server is gonna put a pit of soul fire under your house.
404418521792 lmao
It should be a very subtle screaming/moaning type noise, similar to the ambient noises in Soul Sand Valleys.
A breathy noise would be much better since screams are way too gory.
It sound have more like a whisper scream to it hidden in the sound of flames so it's not too loud or annoying. Should work with campfires too
I think this should be an option in settings
Doesn’t this already happen

Yes! It was already this way, then in 1.7 they changed it and it's apparently intended... How something of this nature would be changed and why it would be closed instead of fixed when it angers people is beyond me. I have no idea why this needs to be a feature request, this is a bug and should be considered one.

 

Would you please add this bug report link to your post so the devs can see how the mods closed what is very clearly a BUG from being discussed or voted?

I would very much like this!
I don't want to go into the game options every time to turn off the in game music just to be able to hear the music disc clearly.
And I don't want to just permanently turn off my in game music either because I just like having it on.
Perhaps the in game music could slowly fade out instead of cutting out cold for a more chill feel when a music disc starts playing.

This especially sucks for packs like some of mine that change the ambient music to be louder songs, like I don't want to have to turn off the background music to listen to the disc it should just automatically happen
This would be great. It's annoying when I'm trying to listen to a music disc and the background music overlaps it in the background.

I've seen complaints saying "okay then what about players a hundred blocks away who can barely hear it should the sound be off for them?" and the answer is so incredibly simple, just have the amibent music fade in and out when you get closer to the jukebox and have the player who put the disc in it in the first place have their music stopped period so they can only hear the disc.
That would be awesome
when i saw the amethyst i had the same idea
We need this!
I think it should make the same bell sound as the gold block, right now in bedrock it only makes a stone sound, and one other thing, the raw gold block should also make the bell sound
this was the first thing i tried to do with amethyst when I first found some I wish this were a thing

I think that mojang allready have this in mind. But pointing it out is good too. I thought of it too. The first time when you enter the dark cave without the torch only with your stone pickaxe and the sound of the cave just gives you chills. It hink there should be definetly some good cave sounds maybe some whispering or like wind is coming through the cave. The dripping of the water as you get closer. Sounds like a stone that hits the ground from what ever is in that dark cave. And your brain is just thinking what could it be? Zombie? Creeper? Or the new beast... the Warden?
Very much on board with this, the deep dark demo wouldn't have shined nearly as well as at did if it weren't for the music.
I love this idea! Maybe the Volume Alpha music Equinoxe and Excuse could work well along with some new music too?
I think Moog city and Moog city 2 would also be good music for the caves or at night anyways
I want Mojang to bring back the unused music from the past, like Excuse, Chris, Equinoxe, etc. Of course, except Death.
Oh, they have music.  But let's just say it's mostly "Eerie noise" ;)
I just noticed this today, it would be fun if they got a low snoring sound instead!

I agree, but my brother can also say something while sleeping.

Making it rare would a nice idea. Other sleeping sound would a great idea as well
I think the end credits are pretty good at this.
Sì un suono come quando strappi uno straccio in stoffa.
I agree. There is a huge opportunity here at a relatively small cost performace wise. Just having new foley alone would completely change the vibe of the game.

Definitely! This would make Minecraft feel more alive and less lonely, and it’d make the ambience a lot better. After all, the ambience is why I honestly really like the Nether. Personally I love this idea :)
I agree lots of the times in the Overworld it is empty and it causes paranoia
I very much agree with this. Without ambience it gets so lonely and creepy. The overlord needs it, the nether is perfect, and also the end. The end is suppose to lack ambience and be lonely.

Maybe for a resourcepack but there should not be a sound. There was already a sound and it got removed. Also how would the game know how to decide if the player is a boy or girl or even neither therefore it is impossible.
You can edit sounds.json to choose what pool of sounds it chooses from
Just an echoing silence when you die
maybe the ouh from the old days
Oh that's why I couldn't find a player death sound in the Minecraft files…

I genuinely agree, I just wanna play Minecraft and hear these tracks again. Reminds me of the times where the biggest thing I had to worry about was whether I got to see my friend or not when my big bro got home from school.

I completely agree and very strongly want this added, the new music is nice but extremely limited and repetitive, I miss the old original C418 music like "Wet Hands" and "Sweden". An option to choose between the new and original just makes sense and doesn't make sense why it hasn't been added yet.
I'm amazed Bedrock only has the new tracks now. I don't want these - I want the original music.
Voted! Perhaps the sounds could change at night so maybe in the forest at daytime, there could, like you said, be birds chirping while at night there could be owls?
Certain places and events have no ambience, like if the warden is around all ambience and music is stopped, or no ambience in the end.

This idea is so underrated! They did it for the Nether, they can do it for the overworld. It just needs to be really subtle, and there needs to be the possibility of complete silence at certain times of day, regardless of the biome. Too much constant ambiance would be annoying.
Hi, I like the idea of "Boss Themes" Keep posting :)

This is a good idea because it is just disappointing when you here the pillaged horn and then just nothing after that. Just a suggestion what if you hear marching that gets louder the closer you get to a village with the bad omen effect and during the raid you can hear many crossbows being drawn and tired in the background that decreased along with the more pillaged you kill.
The Ender Dragon does have a theme, it's called "Boss", but it's not very different from the "End" soundtrack.
